    • Method Detail

      • parseRData

        public static RData parseRData(short type,
                               byte[] data,
                               int start,
                               int length)
                        throws RDataNotSupportedException
        Generates an RData object given the appropriate type and assuming the data at the specified index is encoded properly.
        The following are supported RData types:
        1 - A - Internet Address
        2 - NS - Name Server
        5 - CNAME - Canonical Name
        6 - SOA - Start of Authority
        11 - WKS - Well Known Service
        12 - PTR - Domain Pointer
        13 - HINFO - Host Information
        15 - MX - Mail Exchange
        16 - TXT - Text Data

        Types listed in RFC 1035 as (EXPERIMENTAL) or (Obsolete) are unsupported.
        Parameters:
        type - The RData type as described above.
        data - The raw byte data to form the RData object from.
        start - The byte index to start reading from.
        length - The length in bytes of the RData object.
        Returns:
        If the type is supported, returns an RData object representing the contents of the encoded RData object in data at start.
        Throws:
        RDataNotSupportedException - An exception is thrown if the provided type is unsupported.
        See Also:
        RFC 1035 Section 3.2.2 - Type Values
